{{Infobox Windows component | name = Windows Store | logo = <!-- Please put Windows Store logo in this article --> | logo_size = | screenshot = <!-- Please put Windows Store - Coming Soon screenshot in this article --> | screenshot_size = | caption = <!--The Windows Store in Windows 8--> | other_names = | type = [[Digital distribution]] | service_name = | service_description = | included_with = [[Windows 8]] | also_available_for = | replaces = [[Windows Marketplace]] | replaced_by = | support_status = | related_components = }} '''Windows Store''' is an upcoming [[online distribution|digital distribution]] platform developed by Microsoft Corporation as part of [[Windows 8]] for [[Metro (design language)|Metro]]-style apps.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.softpedia.com/news/Get-Insight-into-the-Windows-Store-in-Windows-8-226006.shtml|title=Get Insight into the Windows Store in Windows 8|accessdate=2011-10-19|date=2011-10-06|publisher=Softpedia|author=Marius Oiaga}}</ref> The Windows Store will also allow developers to advertise their Win32 or "traditional desktop" applications.
On September 13, 2011, day one of the BUILD developer conference, Microsoft's Windows President Steven Sinofsky announced the Windows Store app and its features and demonstrated the store. Although the publically available Windows Developer Preview includes the Windows Store app, it does not function and simply displays a "coming soon" message.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.techairlines.com/2011/09/18/windows-8-developer-preview/|title=Windows 8 on a laptop in-depth preview (video)|accessdate=2011-10-19|date=2011-09-16|author=Dana Wollman|publisher=engadget}}.</ref>
The Windows Store will be the only means of distributing Metro-style apps to users to allow Microsoft to scan apps for security flaws and malware.<ref>{{cite web|last=Tom|first=Warren|title=Microsoft details and demos the Windows Store for Windows 8|url=http://www.winrumors.com/microsoft-details-and-demos-the-windows-store-for-windows-8-video/|publisher=Winrumors.com|accessdate=19 September 2011}}</ref> The licensing and revenue share through the Windows Store have yet to be confirmed.<ref>http://www.pcworld.com/article/239994/windows_8_app_store_what_we_know_so_far.html</ref>
